Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2010 05:10PM 1Badboob wrote: Hi Coryjm, If you found a lump, make an appointment with a doctor. If you feel as though you want a mammogram you should get one, we all have to be our own best advocates. You have found a great site, I have found so much info on this site. I'm fairly new to all this. My whole family, DH not included has been so supportive, find out for sure, but it's probably, hopefully benign, but make sure it is and have it out anyway!  1badboob
Posts.Title: Who do you tell? coryjm krandle

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2010 01:05AM 1Badboob wrote: You keep moving forward. My oncoligist said it best, she too has dealt with cancer. Try to live life as if you never had it but never forget what youve learned from it. Life is more precious than ever now, its unfortunate we have to be a part of this club but we are still here, we are still alive. I'm making sure I accomplish more than just existing. ((((Sending you a warm hug))))))) The holidays make it even harder but remember your here,you're alive and you are loved.

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 11:00AM - edited Nov 11, 2011 11:41AM by 1Badboob Hello all, We can always request a Pat down and opt out of the machine, that's everyone's right. Just thought I'd add that. Wishing everyone peace, love and support through this!

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 05:52PM 1Badboob wrote: oh dear, you do not want to go this alone! I had help, some I even had to ask for their help. Let people help you, this is the time in your life where you should let people help. By your stats you look like you have a good prognosis. Hang in there and this to shall pass.
Posts.Title: going at it alone? migallen migallen

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 06:36AM - edited Nov 13, 2011 06:37AM by 1Badboob Jtsig,  First, I want to give you  BIG gentle hug, I don't think anyone has mentioned this but if the doctor says it's okay to shower you can tie a shoelace around your waist, tuck the Drains in there, or you could get a soft cotton cammie that is velcro and has pockets for the drains, hang in there, I know this seems like a nightmare, but you will get through it one step at a time, one moment at a time.  I hated the drains but when they were removed it didn't hurt, they're just simply put hard to take and look at. You will heal, physically, mentally, you will heal. There are postives, harder to find but there are, it's not invasive and it was very early stage, precancerous, all very very good things in the cancer world. You will find a new normal when you are further away from this. You're not alone.
Posts.Title: Help-complications force me to join this "club" jtslg lollypop59

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2010 09:16PM 1Badboob wrote: Hi singletona, Just get a prescription from your BC doc, if you have insurance it should cover it. I got mine the very same day but you need to make an appointment. Good luck, I'm new to this stuff but you can pm me if you need more info. 1badboob
Posts.Title: How long does it take to get a prosthesis singletona80 Barbaramess20

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 05:55AM 1Badboob wrote: The key is not to panic, Yes, this is a bad time and it is fear of the unknown but once you know all the info you can attack this head on. This is the worst time, a lot of women will tell you that. There is so much help out there and you are not alone, my best advice is to stay calm because this is a very bumpy ride. Keep all your paperwork, you should have something to keep them in anyway, bills, because this can be very overwhelming and bills don't just stop cause were feeling overwhelmed. You are not alone, there is so much help out there and treatment and many kinds of breast cancer, some are a lot less aggressive then others, knowledge is power. You will find all the support you need here feel free to PM me with any questions dear
